intro: Epilobium helodes, commonly known as narrowleaf willowherb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and roadsides. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are showy, with five pink or reddish petals and numerous stamens, blooming in late spring to early summer. Epilobium helodes is often found in wetland habitats and can be an indicator species for waterlogged soils.
